data.title: correct assign to equal in cert trust expression
data.body: This PR simply fixes an obvious bug which uses assign(=) in a boolean expression

data.title: dlfree fix for HttpClient, the instances of Ref or its sub classes should be released by CC_SAFE_RELEASE rather than CC_SAFE_DELETE.
data.body:
This patch fix crash while exiting game. The crash information is:

```
A/libc(16401): heap corruption detected by dlfree
```

This time I created a new branch in my fork and I'm doing a pull request from it. I think it is better a better and clean choice.

My old attempt was https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/15686

Thanks and best!

data.title: NDK 12
data.body:
The new NDK that Android Studio downloads by default adds the `arm64-v8a` support that https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/15566 is looking for, but it doesn't appear to work.

```
Android NDK: ERROR:/home/rphelps/code/proj.android-studio/../cocos2d/external/freetype2/prebuilt/android/Android.mk:cocos_freetype2_static: LOCAL_SRC_FILES points to a missing file
Android NDK: Check that /home/rphelps/code/proj.android-studio/../cocos2d/external/freetype2/prebuilt/android/arm64-v8a/libfreetype.a exists  or that its path is correct
```

data.title: Use nullptr instead of 0 or NULL
data.body: In C++11 and later, we should use `nullptr` instead of `0` or `NULL` if possible.  So this PR changes some null pointer constants to `nullptr` and makes them consistent with the [coding style](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/wiki/Cpp--Coding-Style#0-and-nullptrnull).

data.title: fix: update damping in physics
data.body: github issue #15630

data.title: [v3.9, iOS/Android] EditBox wraps text and loses text's alignment
data.body:
problem: **EditBox wraps text and loses text's alignment.**
cocos2d-x version: **v3.9**
platform: **iOS, Android**

Sample code:

```
_emailEditBox = cocos2d::ui::EditBox::create( emailEditBoxBackground->getOriginalSize(),
                                              emailEditBoxBackground );
_emailEditBox->setInputFlag( cocos2d::ui::EditBox::InputFlag::SENSITIVE );
_emailEditBox->setInputMode( cocos2d::ui::EditBox::InputMode::EMAIL_ADDRESS );
_emailEditBox->setReturnType( cocos2d::ui::EditBox::KeyboardReturnType::DONE );
_emailEditBox->setFont( editBoxFontName.c_str(), editBoxFontSize );
_emailEditBox->setFontColor( BROWN );
_emailEditBox->setMaxLength( 50 );
_emailEditBox->setDelegate( this );
```

iOS:
When I type it is fine:
![lackoftrancating](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5878299/15504674/02526494-21b8-11e6-9575-2ad75d49e60d.png)
When I leave the editBox it will truncate the text a bit, but it also loses texts alignment:
![lackoftrancating2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5878299/15504679/06f90a34-21b8-11e6-85eb-1db0dcacae84.png)
When I change the text to shorter, it will still keep the wrong alignment.
![lackoftrancating3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5878299/15504685/0bf3b534-21b8-11e6-8d6e-a42f276339d5.png)

Android:
When I type longer text it will wrap it (it shouldn't or it should be optional):
![device-2016-05-24-133804](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5878299/15504652/ed709b36-21b7-11e6-97e8-fb9a8230f778.png)

When I reduce longer text it will use the wrong alignment:
![device-2016-05-24-133928](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5878299/15504653/ed754ef6-21b7-11e6-94a7-51d2a7c16c85.png)

data.title: [v3.9, iOS/Android] EditBox prints capital letters by default
[Cocos2d-x 3.11, Linux]: SimpleAudioEngine::playEffect() doesn't work correctly on Linux
BMFont and LabelAtlas support TextureAtlas and benefit from auto-batch
CheckBox isn't working
data.body:
ui/UICheckBox.cpp:78
`create` call `init` with `backGroundSeleted = ""`
then
ui/UIAbstractCheckButton.cpp:171
`loadTextureBackGroundSelected` call `setSpriteFrame("")`
then
2d/CCSprite.cpp:1034
`setSpriteFrame` func have assert
`CCASSERT(!spriteFrameName.empty(), "spriteFrameName must not be empty");`
and it strange but next line
`if (spriteFrameName.empty())
 {
     return;
 }`

in some previous version (3.9 i think)
`loadTextureBackGroundSelected` func contains
`if (backGroundSelected.empty())
{
    return;
}`
and
`setSpriteFrame` func havn't assert

data.title: lock mutext to get element from g_queue
fix compiling error on windows caused by new libwebsocket
The function "stExpCocoNode::GetType" may return wrong type
don't strip png text
Fix typo in function name: Keybard -> Keyboard
data.body: This fixes misspelling of the word `Keyboard`.

data.title: Fix test cases with PVRTC textures loading
data.body: Fix test cases with PVRTC textures loading for devices that don't support these formats

data.title: use manifestUrl from remote version
data.body:
In case if local version file is very old, and remote version has changed the manifest url ever since, this fix will make sure that AssetsManagerEx will download the correct manifest file.

This PR is moved from https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/15689#issuecomment-220927212

data.title: libpng error: CgBI: unhandled critical chunk
data.body:
Originally discussed in this thread, https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/15199
The error happens at Texture2D::initWithImage (Cocos2d-x 3.10) only with an actual iOS device, not on an iOS simulator, and the solution is we had to disable both "Compress PNG Files" and "Remove Text Metadata From PNG files" on Xcode 7.2. It seems this issue persists for years. Is it possible to remedy it at the side of Cocos2d-x?

data.title: Animation reset color and opacity of Sprite
data.body:
When I change color or opacity of Sprite and run Animate, color and opacity will be back to default in every setSpriteFrame.
This happens only if TexturePacker algorithm is polygon.

http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/animation-reset-color-and-opacity-of-sprite/29452

data.title: Suggestion: Move the macro `COCOS2D_VERSION` to ccConfig.h
data.body: In current version, the macro `COCOS2D_VERSION` is in `cocos2d.h`. We need this macro, but we don't want to include `cocos2d.h`. Because `cocos2d.h` includes a lot of c++ header files, which will slow down the compilation when i include `cocos2d.h` directly in my project.

data.title: RenderTexture -> newImage() not working
Suggestion: TextFieldTTF gives an option to disable text auto correction.
data.body:
With current v3.11, I couldn't find an easy way to do that for all platforms.
It would be great if I could add one line of code and TextFieldTTF disables text auto correction for me.

data.title: Prevent too many C4996 warnings caused by ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()
data.body:
Hello,

When I use the latest cocos2d-x (since commit 86df9b535a5d51479ee6eaa93b85d991b4c3c974) in my project with Visual Studio 2015, I got a lot of warning messages about `Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` was declared deprecated.

Then I tried to build libcocos2d and cpp-tests, it can reproduce the same warning as following:

```
5>cocos\2d/CCSprite.h(474): warning C4996: 'cocos2d::Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition': was declared deprecated (compiling source file ..\ui\UIButton.cpp)
5>cocos\2d/CCSprite.h(474): warning C4996: 'cocos2d::Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition': was declared deprecated (compiling source file ..\ui\UIRichText.cpp)
...
6>cocos\2d/CCSprite.h(474): warning C4996: 'cocos2d::Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition': was declared deprecated (compiling source file ..\Classes\BillBoardTest\BillBoardTest.cpp)
6>cocos\2d/CCSprite.h(474): warning C4996: 'cocos2d::Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition': was declared deprecated (compiling source file ..\Classes\ActionsTest\ActionsTest.cpp)
...
```

![cocos2d-x-pull-15692](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4461792/15451537/17c90b5e-2003-11e6-9d0b-1782272c9d5a.png)

The warning C4996 seem to be caused by the `Sprite::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` function which override the deprecated `Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` function in the `CCSprite.h` file. I know we need to fully support the `ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` for backwards compatibility, but those warning messages are too many for me (and CI such as Jenkins).

So this PR removes the function definition of the `Sprite::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` to prevent the warning, for these reasons:
- `Sprite::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` and `Sprite::setIgnoreAnchorPointForPosition()` are both overridding virtual functions of the `Node` class.
- `Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` calls `setIgnoreAnchorPointForPosition()` internally. 
- `Sprite::setIgnoreAnchorPointForPosition()` is executed when the `Node::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()` is invoked instead of `Sprite::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()`.
- This change will not affect C++ APIs and the documentation generated by doxygen.

In other words, I think it's unnecessary to explicitly keep the definition of the `Sprite::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition()`.

I've also tried to verify if this change keeps backwards compatibility with the following test case:

```
auto sprite = Sprite::create("HelloWorld.png");

// `Sprite::setIgnoreAnchorPointForPosition()` function can be invoked in 3 different ways:
sprite->ignoreAnchorPointForPosition(true);
sprite->Sprite::ignoreAnchorPointForPosition(true);
static_cast<Node*>(sprite)->ignoreAnchorPointForPosition(true);

addChild(sprite);
```

The same issue has been reported here:
http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/gen-libs-error-c4996/29404

Thank you for taking your time to read this. :smiley:

data.title: Ubuntu 16.04 - isnan error
data.body:
Ubuntu 16.04. Cocos2d-x v3.11.

Compiling `cpp-tests` results in an error when compiling spidermonkey/js bindings.

![screen shot 2016-05-20 at 1 14 45 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7491758/15435889/f1aff242-1e8c-11e6-8b95-368ef4faec6b.png)

Please see this thread on the forums: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/building-on-ubuntu-16-04-issues/29051

One user suggested adding `using namespace std;` to a few files. After doing this`cpp-tests` still does not compile successfully for me.

data.title: change if (fontName.c_str()) to if(!fontName.empty())
data.body: fix warnning, change if (fontName.c_str()) to if(!fontName.empty()), The first expression's value always true.

data.title: Suspendable and configurable Downloader and AssetsManagerEx
data.body:
## This PR does the following things
- Added suspend/resume methods to Downloader for apple & android
- Added suspend/resume methods AssetsManagerEx
- Made AssetsManagerEx more configurable
  - configurable storage path
  - configurable downloader hints
- Optimized apple downloader, putting expensive tasks creation & I/O operations into a background queue to avoid UI blocking
- Slightly improved the performance of generating manifest diff for AssetsManagerEx(around 10% ~ 20%)
- Refactored Cocos2dxDownloader.java, correcting the coding style inconsistency 

Detailed description is written in each commit message.
## TODO
- [ ] Add tests for suspend/resume
- [ ] Add implementation for curl downloader (currently it is assert(false)) ?
- [ ] js & lua bindings ?

@minggo Would you mind discussing how we should proceed on these TODOs? Thanks:)

data.title: Cocos JS 3.11 PhysicsSprite chipmunk Bug
data.body:
create a physicsSprite and set spaceshape body
update to cocos 3.11
this sprite cannot move with shape in sence
useing cocos3.10 not have this bug

data.title: fix compiling error on ubuntu 16.04 because of isnan
